revised_title: Inquiry into the Contagious Distemper among Horned Cattle and the Effectiveness of Inoculation
tldr: The author, Daniel-Peter Layard, shares his findings on the contagious distemper among horned cattle and the effectiveness of inoculation. He explains how the disease was spread from Holland to other regions and how it was eventually controlled by killing infected animals and burying them properly. Layard also discusses the use of inoculation in Denmark and other countries, which he believes to be an effective method of controlling the disease.
